page.title: 11Use by Armed Forces
page.content: The Quantock Hills provide exacting terrain for the training of the{Royal {Marines,}while offering the{Royal Air {Force}an obstacle to be negotiated by pilots engaged in low-flying exercises. From{R.A.F Chivernor}fly{Hawks} at a height of 250 feet to avoid detection by modern radar.The flightpath is not fixed,though the aircratt must maintain a course away from highly populated areas.On most days they can seen and heard clearly as they fly overhead at speeds ranging from 400 to 700 knots.
